  • Field Details

    • useButlerBlacklist

      public boolean useButlerBlacklist
      If true, will use blacklist for rejecting users from using your player as a butler

    • useButlerWhitelist

      public boolean useButlerWhitelist
      If true, will use whitelist to only accept users from said whitelist.

    • whisperFormats

      public String[] whisperFormats
      Servers have different messaging plugins that change the way messages are displayed. Rather than attempt to implement all of them and introduce a big security risk, you may define custom whisper formats that the butler will watch out for.

      Within curly brackets are three special parts:

      {from}: Who the message was sent from {to}: Who the message was sent to, butler will ignore if this is not your username. {message}: The message.

      WARNING: The butler will only accept non-chat messages as commands, but don't make this too lenient, else you may risk unauthorized control to the bot. Basically, make sure that only whispers can create the following messages.

    • whisperFormatDebug

      public boolean whisperFormatDebug
      If set to true, will print information about whispers that are parsed and those that have failed parsing. Enable this if you need help setting up the whisper format.

    • sendAuthorizationResponse

      public boolean sendAuthorizationResponse
      Determines if failure messages should be sent to a non-authorized entity attempting to use butler Disable this if you need to stay undercover.

    • failedAuthorizationResposne

      public String failedAuthorizationResposne
      The response sent in a failed execution due to non-authorization {from}: the username of the player who triggered the failed authorization response

    • requirePrefixMsg

      public boolean requirePrefixMsg
      Use this to choose if the prefix should be required in messages Disable this if you want to be able to send normal messages and not butler commands.
